name: endo-alpha-N-acetylgalactosaminidase
definition: (1) a 3-O-[beta-D-galactosyl-(1->3)-N-acetyl-alpha-D-galactosaminyl]-L-seryl-[protein] + H2O = beta-D-galactosyl-(1->3)-N-acetyl-D-galactosamine+ L-seryl-[protein](2) a 3-O-[beta-D-galactosyl-(1->3)-N-acetyl-alpha-D-galactosaminyl]-L-threonyl-[protein] + H2O = beta-D-galactosyl-(1->3)-N-acetyl-D-galactosamine + L-threonyl-[protein]

name: glucan 1,4-alpha-maltohexaosidase
definition: Hydrolysis of (1->4)-alpha-D-glucosidic linkages in amylaceouspolysaccharides, to remove successive maltohexaose residues from the non-reducing chain ends

name: blood group B branched chain alpha-1,3-galactosidase
definition: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing branched (1->3)-alpha-D-galactosidicresidues, producing free D-galactose

name: blood group B linear chain alpha-1,3-galactosidase
definition: Hydrolysis of terminal, non-reducing linear (1->3)-alpha-D-galactosidicresidues, producing free D-galactose

name: Dictyostelium lysozyme A
definition: Hydrolysis of 1,4-beta-linkages between N-acetylmuramic acid andN-acetyl-D-glucosamine residues in a peptidoglycan

name: purine nucleosidase
definition: a purine D-ribonucleoside + H2O = a purine nucleobase + D-ribose
synonyms: IAG-NH|IAG-nucleoside hydrolase|N-D-ribosylpurine ribohydrolase|N-ribosyl purine ribohydrolase|inosine-adenosine-guanosine preferring nucleoside hydrolase|nucleosidase|nucleosidase g|nucleoside hydrolase|purine beta-ribosidase|purine nucleoside hydrolase|purine ribonucleosidase|purine-specific nucleoside N-ribohydrolase|ribonucleoside hydrolase

name: pyrimidine-5'-nucleotide nucleosidase
definition: a pyrimidine ribonucleoside 5'-phosphate + H2O = a pyrimidine nucleobase+ D-ribose 5-phosphate

name: DNA-deoxyinosine glycosylase
definition: Hydrolyzes DNA and polynucleotides, releasing free hypoxanthine

name: deoxyribodipyrimidine endonucleosidase
definition: Cleaves the N-glycosidic bond between the 5'-pyrimidine residue incyclobutadipyrimidine (in DNA) and the corresponding deoxy-D-riboseresidue

name: [protein ADP-ribosylarginine] hydrolase
synonyms: ADP-ribose-L-arginine cleavage enzyme|ADP-ribose-L-arginine cleaving enzyme|ADP-ribosylarginine hydrolase|N(omega)-(ADP-D-ribosyl)-L-arginine ADP-ribosylhydrolase

name: DNA-3-methyladenine glycosylase II
definition: Hydrolysis of alkylated DNA, releasing 3-methyladenine, 3-methylguanine,7-methylguanine and 7-methyladenine

name: rRNA N-glycosylase
definition: Endohydrolysis of the N-glycosidic bond at one specific adenosine on the28S rRNA

name: DNA-formamidopyrimidine glycosylase
definition: Hydrolysis of DNA containing ring-opened 7-methylguanine residues,releasing 2,6-diamino-4-hydroxy-5-(N-methyl)formamidopyrimidine

name: uracil-DNA glycosylase
definition: Hydrolyzes single-stranded DNA or mismatched double-stranded DNA andpolynucleotides, releasing free uracil

name: double-stranded uracil-DNA glycosylase
definition: Specifically hydrolyzes mismatched double-stranded DNA andpolynucleotides, releasing free uracil

name: thymine-DNA glycosylase
definition: Hydrolyzes mismatched double-stranded DNA and polynucleotides, releasingfree thymine
synonyms: TDG|mismatch-specific thymine-DNA N-glycosylase|mismatch-specific thymine-DNA glycosylase|thymine DNA glycosylase|uracil/thymine DNA glycosylase

name: adenine glycosylase
definition: Hydrolyzes free adenine bases from 7,8-dihydro-8-oxoguanine:adeninemismatched double-stranded DNA, leaving an apurinic site

name: NAD(+) glycohydrolase
synonyms: ADP-ribosyl cyclase|DPN hydrolase|DPNase|NAD glycohydrolase|NAD nucleosidase|NAD(+) nucleosidase|NADase|beta-NAD(+) glycohydrolase|diphosphopyridine nucleosidase|nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide glycohydrolase|nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide nucleosidase

name: ADP-ribosyl cyclase/cyclic ADP-ribose hydrolase
synonyms: NAD hydrolase|NAD(+) nucleosidase|NADase|nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide nucleosidase

name: ribosylpyrimidine nucleosidase
definition: a pyrimidine ribonucleoside + H2O = a pyrimidine nucleobase + D-ribose

name: adenosylhomocysteine nucleosidase
definition: (1) S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + H2O = S-(5-deoxy-D-ribos-5-yl)-L-homocysteine + adenine(2) 5'-deoxyadenosine + H2O = 5-deoxy-D-ribose + adenine(3) S-methyl-5'-thioadenosine + H2O = 5-(methylsulfanyl)-D-ribose +adenine

name: cytokinin riboside 5'-monophosphate phosphoribohydrolase
definition: (1) N(6)-(dimethylallyl)adenosine 5'-phosphate + H2O = N(6)-dimethylallyladenine + D-ribose 5-phosphate(2) 9-ribosyl-trans-zeatin 5'-phosphate + H2O = trans-zeatin + D-ribose5-phosphate

name: soluble epoxide hydrolase
synonyms: arene-oxide hydratase|aryl epoxide hydrase|cytosolic epoxide hydrolase|epoxide hydrase|epoxide hydratase|trans-stilbene oxide hydrolase

name: lysoplasmalogenase
definition: (1) a 1-O-(1Z-alkenyl)-sn-glycero-3-phosphocholine + H2O = a 2,3-saturated aldehyde + sn-glycerol 3-phosphocholine(2) a 1-O-(1Z-alkenyl)-sn-glycero-3-phosphoethanolamine + H2O = a 2,3-saturated aldehyde + sn-glycero-3-phosphoethanolamine

name: hepoxilin-epoxide hydrolase
synonyms: hepoxilin A3 hydrolase|hepoxilin epoxide hydrolase|hepoxylin hydrolase

name: microsomal epoxide hydrolase
synonyms: arene-oxide hydratase|aryl epoxide hydrase|benzo[a]pyrene-4,5-oxide hydratase|cis-epoxide hydrolase|epoxide hydrase|epoxide hydratase|mEH|microsomal epoxide hydrase|microsomal epoxide hydratase|microsomal oxirane/oxetane hydrolase

name: leucyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Xaa-|-Yaa-, in which Xaa ispreferably Leu, but may be other amino acids including Pro although notArg or Lys, and Yaa may be Pro. Amino acid amides and methyl esters arealso readily hydrolyzed, but rates on arylamides are exceedingly low

name: bacterial leucyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, preferentially leucine, but notglutamic or aspartic acids

name: clostridial aminopeptidase
definition: Release of any N-terminal amino acid, including proline andhydroxyproline, but no cleavage of Xaa-|-Pro

name: cytosol alanyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, preferentially alanine, from a widerange of peptides, amides and arylamides
synonyms: aminopolypeptidase|arylamidase|cytosol aminopeptidase III|liver aminopeptidase|puromycin-sensitive aminopeptidase|soluble alanyl aminopeptidase

name: Xaa-Trp aminopeptidase
definition: Release of a variety of N-terminal residues (especially glutamate andleucine) from peptides, provided tryptophan (or at least phenylalanine ortyrosine) is the penultimate residue. Also acts on Glu-|-Trp, Leu-|-Trpand a number of other dipeptides

name: tryptophanyl aminopeptidase
definition: an N-terminal L-tryptophanyl-L-alpha-aminoacyl-[peptide] + H2O =an N-terminal L-alpha-aminoacyl-[peptide] + L-tryptophan

name: methionyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of N-terminal amino acids, preferentially methionine, frompeptides and arylamides

name: D-stereospecific aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal D-amino acid from a peptide, Xaa-|-Yaa-,in which Xaa is preferably D-Ala, D-Ser or D-Thr. D-amino acid amides andmethyl esters also are hydrolyzed, as is glycine amide

name: membrane alanyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Xaa-|-Yaa- from a peptide, amide orarylamide. Xaa is preferably Ala, but may be most amino acids includingPro (slow action). When a terminal hydrophobic residue is followed by aprolyl residue, the two may be released as an intact Xaa-Pro dipeptide
synonyms: amino-oligopeptidase|aminopeptidase M|aminopeptidase N|membrane alanine aminopeptidase|membrane aminopeptidase I|microsomal aminopeptidase|particle-bound aminopeptidase|peptidase E

name: aminopeptidase Ey
definition: Differs from other aminopeptidases in broad specificity for amino acidsin the P1 position and the ability to hydrolyze peptides of four or fiveresidues that contain Pro in the P1' position

name: aspartyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal aspartate or glutamate from a peptide, with apreference for aspartate

name: aminopeptidase I
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, preferably a neutral or hydrophobicone, from a polypeptide. Aminoacyl-arylamides are poor substrates
synonyms: aminopeptidase III|aminopeptidase yscI|leucine aminopeptidase IV|vacuolar aminopeptidase I

name: PepB aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Xaa, from a peptide or arylamideXaa is preferably Glu or Asp but may be other amino acids, including Leu,Met, His, Cys and Gln

name: aminopeptidase S
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid with a preference for largehydrophobic amino-terminus residues

name: beta-peptidyl aminopeptidase
definition: Cleaves N-terminal beta-homoamino acids from peptides composed of 2 to 6amino acids

name: intermediate cleaving peptidase 55
definition: The enzyme cleaves the 36-Pro-Pro-37 bond of cysteine desulfurase(EC 2.8.1.7) removing three amino acid residues (Tyr-Ser-Pro) from theN-terminus after cleavage by mitochondrial processing peptidase

name: archaeal arginyl aminopeptidase
definition: an N-terminal L-arginyl-L-aminoacyl-[protein] + H2O = an N-terminalL-alpha-aminoacyl-[protein] + L-arginine

name: cystinyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal amino acid, Cys-|-Xaa-, in which the half-cystine residue is involved in a disulfide loop, notably in oxytocin orvasopressin. Hydrolysis rates on a range of aminoacyl arylamides exceedthat for the cystinyl derivative, however

name: tripeptide aminopeptidase
definition: Release of the N-terminal residue from a tripeptide

name: prolyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of N-terminal proline from a peptide
synonyms: Pro-X aminopeptidase|cytosol aminopeptidase V|proline aminopeptidase|proline iminopeptidase

name: aminopeptidase B
definition: Release of N-terminal Arg and Lys from oligopeptides when P1' is not ProAlso acts on arylamides of Arg and Lys
synonyms: arginine aminopeptidase|arginyl aminopeptidase|arylamidase II|cytosol aminopeptidase IV

name: glutamyl aminopeptidase
definition: Release of N-terminal glutamate (and to a lesser extent aspartate) from apeptide
synonyms: aminopeptidase A|angiotensinase A|aspartate aminopeptidase|glutamyl peptidase|membrane aminopeptidase II

name: Xaa-Pro aminopeptidase
definition: Release of any N-terminal amino acid, including proline, that is linkedto proline, even from a dipeptide or tripeptide

name: non-stereospecific dipeptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of dipeptides containing either D- or L-amino acids or both

name: cytosol non-specific dipeptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of dipeptides, preferentially hydrophobic dipeptides includingprolyl amino acids
synonyms: N(2)-beta-alanylarginine dipeptidase|Pro-X dipeptidase|glycyl-glycine dipeptidase|glycyl-leucine dipeptidase|peptidase A|prolinase|prolyl dipeptidase|prolylglycine dipeptidase

name: membrane dipeptidase
definition: an L-aminoacyl-L-amino acid + H2O = 2 an L-alpha-amino acid

name: beta-Ala-His dipeptidase
definition: Preferential hydrolysis of the beta-Ala-|-His dipeptide (carnosine),and also anserine, Xaa-|-His dipeptides and other dipeptides includinghomocarnosine

name: dipeptidase E
definition: Dipeptidase E catalyzes the hydrolysis of dipeptides Asp-|-Xaa. It doesnot act on peptides with N-terminal Glu, Asn or Gln, nor does it cleaveisoaspartyl peptides
synonyms: PepE gene product (Salmonella typhimurium)|aspartyl dipeptidase|peptidase E

name: cysteinylglycine-S-conjugate dipeptidase
definition: an S-substituted L-cysteinylglycine + H2O = an S-substituted L-cysteine +glycine

name: Xaa-Arg dipeptidase
definition: (1) beta-alanyl-L-lysine + H2O = beta-alanine + L-lysine(2) beta-alanyl-L-ornithine + H2O = beta-alanine + L-ornithine(3) beta-alanyl-L-arginine + H2O = beta-alanine + L-arginine(4) N(2)-(4-aminobutanoyl)-L-lysine + H2O = 4-aminobutanoate + L-lysine(5) N(2)-(4-aminobutanoyl)-L-ornithine + H2O = 4-aminobutanoate +L-ornithine(6) N(2)-(4-aminobutanoyl)-L-arginine + H2O = 4-aminobutanoate +L-arginine

name: Xaa-methyl-His dipeptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of anserine (beta-alanyl-|-N(pi)-methyl-L-histidine),carnosine, homocarnosine, glycyl-|-leucine and other dipeptides withbroad specificity

name: Xaa-Pro dipeptidase
definition: Xaa-L-Pro dipeptide + H2O = an L-alpha-amino acid + L-proline

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase I
definition: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide, Xaa-Yaa-|-Zaa-, except when Xaa isArg or Lys, or Yaa or Zaa is Pro
synonyms: cathepsin C|cathepsin J|dipeptidyl aminopeptidase I|dipeptidyl transferase

name: tripeptidyl-peptidase II
definition: Release of an N-terminal tripeptide from a polypeptide

name: Xaa-Pro dipeptidyl-peptidase
definition: Hydrolyzes Xaa-Pro-|- bonds to release unblocked, N-terminal dipeptidesfrom substrates including Ala-Pro-|-p-nitroanilide and (sequentially)Tyr-Pro-|-Phe-Pro-|-Gly-Pro-|-Ile

name: Xaa-Xaa-Pro tripeptidyl-peptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of Xaa-Xaa-Pro-|-Yaa- releasing the N-terminal tripeptide of apeptide with Pro as the third residue (position P1) and where Yaa is notproline
synonyms: PTP-A|TPP|prolyl tripeptidyl peptidase|prolyltripeptidyl amino peptidase|prolyltripeptidyl aminopeptidase

name: gamma-D-glutamyl-L-lysine dipeptidyl-peptidase
definition: The enzyme releases L-Ala-gamma-D-Glu dipeptides from cell wall peptidesvia cleavage of an L-Ala-gamma-D-Glu-|-L-Lys bond

name: [mycofactocin precursor peptide] peptidase
definition: [mycofactocin precursor peptide]-C-terminal glycyl-N-{5-[(4-hydroxyphenyl)methyl]-4,4-dimethyl-2-oxopyrrolidin-3-yl}acetamide+ H2O = [mycofactocin precursor peptide]-C-terminal glycine + 3-amino-5-[(4-hydroxyphenyl)methyl]-4,4-dimethyl-2-pyrrolidin-2-one

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase II
definition: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide, Xaa-Yaa-|-, preferentially when Yaais Ala or Pro. Substrates are oligopeptides, preferentially tripeptides
synonyms: DPP II|carboxytripeptidase|dipeptidyl aminopeptidase II|dipeptidyl arylamidase II|quiescent cell proline dipeptidase

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase III
definition: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide from a peptide comprising four or moreresidues, with broad specificity. Also acts on dipeptidyl2-naphthylamides
synonyms: DPP III|dipeptidyl aminopeptidase III|dipeptidyl arylamidase III|enkephalinase B|red cell angiotensinase

name: dipeptidyl-peptidase IV
definition: Release of an N-terminal dipeptide, Xaa-Yaa-|-Zaa-, from a polypeptide,preferentially when Yaa is Pro, provided Zaa is neither Pro norhydroxyproline
synonyms: DPP IV|Gly-Pro naphthylamidase|Xaa-Pro-dipeptidylaminopeptidase|dipeptidyl aminopeptidase IV|post-proline dipeptidyl aminopeptidase IV

name: dipeptidyl-dipeptidase
definition: Preferential release of dipeptides from a tetrapeptide, e.g. Ala-Gly-|-Ala-Gly. Acts more slowly on Ala-Ala-|-Ala-Ala and Gly-Gly-|-Gly-Gly

name: tripeptidyl-peptidase I
definition: Release of an N-terminal tripeptide from a polypeptide, but also hasendopeptidase activity

name: peptidyl-dipeptidase A
definition: Release of a C-terminal dipeptide, oligopeptide-|-Xaa-Yaa, when Xaa isnot Pro, and Yaa is neither Asp nor Glu. Thus, conversion of angiotensinI to angiotensin II, with increase in vasoconstrictor activity, but noaction on angiotensin II
synonyms: ACE|angiotensin I-converting enzyme|carboxycathepsin|dipeptidyl carboxypeptidase I|kininase II|peptidase P|peptidyl dipeptidase I

name: peptidyl-dipeptidase B
definition: Release of a C-terminal dipeptide or exceptionally a tripeptide

name: peptidyl-dipeptidase Dcp
definition: Hydrolysis of unblocked, C-terminal dipeptides from oligopeptides, withbroad specificity. Does not hydrolyze bonds in which P1' is Pro, or bothP1 and P1' are Gly

name: cyanophycinase
synonyms: CGPase|beta-Asp-Arg hydrolyzing enzyme|cyanophycin degrading enzyme|cyanophycin granule polypeptidase

name: lysosomal Pro-Xaa carboxypeptidase
definition: Cleavage of a -Pro-|-Xaa bond to release a C-terminal amino acid
synonyms: angiotensinase C|lysosomal Pro-X carboxypeptidase|lysosomal carboxypeptidase C|proline carboxypeptidase|prolyl carboxypeptidase

name: serine-type D-Ala-D-Ala carboxypeptidase
definition: Preferential cleavage: (Ac)2-L-Lys-D-Ala-|-D-Ala. Also transpeptidationof peptidyl-alanyl moieties that are N-acyl substituents of D-alanine

name: carboxypeptidase C
definition: Release of a C-terminal amino acid with broad specificity
synonyms: carboxypeptidase Y|cathepsin A|lysosomal protective protein|serine-type carboxypeptidase I

name: carboxypeptidase D
definition: Preferential release of a C-terminal arginine or lysine residue

name: carboxypeptidase A
definition: Release of a C-terminal amino acid, but little or no action with -Asp,-Glu, -Arg, -Lys or -Pro

name: carboxypeptidase E
definition: Release of C-terminal arginine or lysine residues from polypeptides

name: glutamate carboxypeptidase
definition: Release of C-terminal glutamate residues from a wide range of N-acylatingmoieties, including peptidyl, aminoacyl, benzoyl, benzyloxycarbonyl,folyl and pteroyl groups

name: carboxypeptidase M
definition: Cleavage of C-terminal arginine or lysine residues from polypeptides

name: carboxypeptidase A2
definition: Similar to that of carboxypeptidase A (EC 3.4.17.1), but with apreference for bulkier C-terminal residues

name: membrane Pro-Xaa carboxypeptidase
definition: Release of a C-terminal residue other than proline, by preferentialcleavage of a prolyl bond

name: carboxypeptidase T
definition: Releases a C-terminal residue, which may be hydrophobic or positivelycharged

name: carboxypeptidase Taq
definition: Release of a C-terminal amino acid with broad specificity, except for-Pro

name: carboxypeptidase B
definition: Preferential release of a C-terminal lysine or arginine amino acid

name: carboxypeptidase U
definition: Release of C-terminal Arg and Lys from a polypeptide
synonyms: TAFI|arginine carboxypeptidase|carboxypeptidase B2|carboxypeptidase R|plasma carboxypeptidase B|thrombin-activatable fibrinolysis inhibitor

name: glutamate carboxypeptidase II
definition: Release of an unsubstituted, C-terminal glutamyl residue, typically fromAc-Asp-Glu or folylpoly-gamma-glutamates

name: metallocarboxypeptidase D
definition: Releases C-terminal Arg and Lys from polypeptides

name: tubulin-glutamate carboxypeptidase
definition: (1) C-terminal L-alpha-aminoacyl-L-glutamyl-L-glutamyl-[tubulin] + H2O =C-terminal L-alpha-aminoacyl-L-glutamyl-[tubulin] + L-glutamate(2) C-terminal L-alpha-aminoacyl-L-glutamyl-[tubulin] + H2O = C-terminalL-alpha-aminoacyl-[tubulin] + L-glutamate

name: glutathione-S-conjugate glycine hydrolase
definition: an S-substituted glutathione + H2O = S-substituted gamma-glutamyl-L-cysteine + glycine

name: lysine carboxypeptidase
definition: Release of a C-terminal basic amino acid, preferentially lysine
synonyms: anaphylatoxin inactivator|arginine carboxypeptidase|carboxypeptidase N|kininase I|lysine(arginine) carboxypeptidase

name: Gly-Xaa carboxypeptidase
definition: Release of a C-terminal amino acid from a peptide in which glycine is thepenultimate amino acid, e.g. Z-Gly-|-Leu

name: alanine carboxypeptidase
definition: Release of a C-terminal alanine from a peptide or a variety of pteroyl oracyl groups

name: muramoylpentapeptide carboxypeptidase
synonyms: D-alanine carboxypeptidase|D-alanine-D-alanine-carboxypeptidase|D-alanyl-D-alanine carboxypeptidase|D-alanyl-D-alanine peptidase|DD-carboxypeptidase|DD-peptidase|PBP5|UDP-N-acetylmuramoyl-tetrapeptidyl-D-alanine alanine-hydrolase|carboxypeptidase D-alanyl-D-alanine|penicillin binding protein 5

name: cathepsin X
definition: Release of C-terminal amino acid residues with broad specificity,but lacks action on C-terminal proline. Shows weak endopeptidaseactivity
synonyms: acid carboxypeptidase|cathepsin B2|cathepsin IV|cathepsin Z|cysteine-type carboxypeptidase|lysosomal carboxypeptidase B

name: acylaminoacyl-peptidase
definition: (1) Cleavage of an N-acetyl or N-formyl amino acid from the N-terminus ofa polypeptide(2) Internal cleavage of oxidized and glycated proteins
synonyms: N-acylpeptide hydrolase|acylamino-acid-releasing enzyme|alpha-N-acylpeptide hydrolase|oxidized protein hydrolase

name: gamma-D-glutamyl-meso-diaminopimelate peptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of gamma-D-glutamyl bonds to the L-terminus (position 7) ofmeso-diaminopimelic acid (meso-A2pm) in 7-(L-Ala-gamma-D-Glu)-meso-A2pmand 7-(L-Ala-gamma-D-Glu)-7-(D-Ala)-meso-A2pm. It is required that theD-terminal amino and carboxy groups of meso-A2pm are unsubstituted
synonyms: endopeptidase I|gamma-D-glutamyl-L-diamino acid endopeptidase I|gamma-D-glutamyl-meso-diaminopimelate peptidase I

name: ubiquitinyl hydrolase 1
definition: Thiol-dependent hydrolysis of ester, thioester, amide, peptide andisopeptide bonds formed by the C-terminal Gly of ubiquitin (a 76-residueprotein attached to proteins as an intracellular targeting signal)

name: glutathione gamma-glutamate hydrolase
definition: (1) glutathione + H2O = L-cysteinylglycine + L-glutamate(2) an S-substituted glutathione + H2O = an S-substitutedL-cysteinylglycine + L-glutamate

name: leukotriene-C4 hydrolase
definition: leukotriene C4 + H2O = leukotriene D4 + L-glutamate

name: desampylase
definition: an N(6)-[small archaeal modifier protein]-[protein]-L-lysine + H2O =a [protein]-L-lysine + a [small archaeal modifier protein]

name: glucosinolate gamma-glutamyl hydrolase
definition: (1) an S-[(1E)-1-(hydroxyimino)-omega-(methylsulfanyl)alkyl]-L-glutathione + H2O = an S-[(1E)-1-(hydroxyimino)-omega-(methylsulfanyl)alkyl]-L-cysteinylglycine + L-glutamate(2) (E)-1-(glutathione-S-yl)-2-(1H-indol-3-yl)acetohydroximate + H2O =(E)-1-(glycyl-L-cystein-S-yl)-2-(1H-indol-3-yl)acetohydroximate +L-glutamate(3) 2-(glutathion-S-yl)-2-(1H-indol-3-yl)acetonitrile + H2O = 2-(glycyl-L-cystein-S-yl)-2-(1H-indol-3-yl)acetonitrile + L-glutamate(4) (Z)-1-(glutathione-S-yl)-2-phenylacetohydroximate + H2O = (Z)-1-(glycyl-L-cystein-S-yl)-2-phenylacetohydroximate + L-glutamate

name: peptidyl-glycinamidase
definition: Cleavage of C-terminal glycinamide from polypeptides

name: pyroglutamyl-peptidase I
definition: Release of an N-terminal pyroglutamyl group from a polypeptide,the second amino acid generally not being Pro

name: beta-aspartyl-peptidase
definition: Cleavage of a beta-linked Asp residue from the N-terminus of apolypeptide

name: pyroglutamyl-peptidase II
definition: Release of the N-terminal pyroglutamyl group from pGlu-|-His-Xaatripeptides and pGlu-|-His-Xaa-Gly tetrapeptides
synonyms: PAP-II|TRH-DE|TRH-degrading ectoenzyme|TRH-specific aminopeptidase|pyroglutamyl aminopeptidase II|thyroliberinase|thyrotropin-releasing hormone degrading ectoenzyme

name: N-formylmethionyl-peptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal, formyl-methionyl residue from a polypeptide

name: folate gamma-glutamyl hydrolase
synonyms: carboxypeptidase G|conjugase|folate conjugase|gamma-Glu-X carboxypeptidase|gamma-glutamyl hydrolase|lysosomal gamma-glutamyl carboxypeptidase|pteroyl-poly-alpha-glutamate hydrolase|tetrahydropteroyl-poly-gamma-glutamyl gamma-glutamyl hydrolase

name: chymotrypsin
definition: Preferential cleavage: Tyr-|-Xaa, Trp-|-Xaa, Phe-|-Xaa, Leu-|-Xaa

name: sedolisin
definition: Hydrolysis of the B chain of insulin at 13-Glu-|-Ala-14, 15-Leu-|-Tyr-16and 25-Phe-|-Tyr-26 and angiotensin I at 4-Tyr-|-Ile-5. A good syntheticsubstrate is Lys-Pro-Ile-Glu-Phe-|-Phe(NO2)-Arg-Leu

name: C-terminal processing peptidase
definition: The enzyme shows specific recognition of a C-terminal tripeptide, Xaa-Yaa-Zaa, in which Xaa is preferably Ala or Leu, Yaa is preferably Ala orTyr, and Zaa is preferably Ala, but then cleaves at a variable distancefrom the C-terminus. A typical cleavage is -Ala-Ala-|-Arg-Ala-Ala-Lys-Glu-Asn-Tyr-Ala-Leu-Ala-Ala
synonyms: Tsp protease|photosystem II D1 protein processing peptidase|protease Re|tail-specific protease

name: physarolisin
definition: Milk clotting activity. Preferential cleavage of 8-Gly-|-Ser-9 in B chainof insulin most rapidly, followed by 11-Leu-|-Val-12,19-Cys(SO(3)H)-|-Gly and 24-Phe-|-Phe-25. No action on Ac-Phe-Tyr(I)2
synonyms: Dictyostelium discoideum aspartic proteinase|Dictyostelium discoideum aspartic proteinase E|Physarum aspartic proteinase|Physarum flavicomum aspartic proteinase|Physarum polycephalum acid proteinase|physaropepsin

name: mannan-binding lectin-associated serine protease-2
definition: Selective cleavage after Arg-223 in complement component C2 (-Ser-Leu-Gly-Arg-|-Lys-Ile-Gln-Ile) and after Arg-76 in complement componentC4 (-Gly-Leu-Gln-Arg-|-Ala-Leu-Glu-Ile)
synonyms: MASP-2|MASP2|MBP-associated serine protease-2|mannan-binding lectin-associated serine peptidase 2|mannose-binding lectin-associated serine protease-2

name: rhomboid protease
definition: Cleaves type-1 transmembrane domains using a catalytic dyad composed ofserine and histidine that are contributed by different transmembranedomains

name: hepsin
definition: Cleavage after basic amino-acid residues, with Arg strongly preferred toLys

name: peptidase Do
definition: Acts on substrates that are at least partially unfolded. The cleavagesite P1 residue is normally between a pair of hydrophobic residues, suchas Val-|-Val
synonyms: HrtA heat shock protein|high temperature requirement protease A|protease Do

name: HtrA2 peptidase
definition: Cleavage of non-polar aliphatic amino-acids at the P1 position, with apreference for Val, Ile and Met. At the P2 and P3 positions, Arg isselected most strongly with a secondary preference for other hydrophilicresidues
synonyms: HtrA2 protease|Omi stress-regulated endoprotease|high temperature requirement protein A2|serine proteinase OMI

name: matriptase
definition: Cleaves various synthetic substrates with Arg or Lys at the P1 positionand prefers small side-chain amino acids, such as Ala and Gly, at the P2position
synonyms: MT-SP1|epithin|membrane-type serine protease 1|prostamin|serine endopeptidase SNC19|serine protease 14|serine protease TADG-15|tumor-associated differentially-expressed gene 15 protein

name: C5a peptidase
definition: The primary cleavage site is at 67-His-|-Lys-68 in human C5a with a minorsecondary cleavage site at 58-Ala-|-Ser-59

name: aqualysin 1
definition: Exhibits low specificity toward esters of amino acids with smallhydrophobic or aromatic residues at the P1 position

name: site-1 protease
definition: Processes precursors containing basic and hydrophobic/aliphatic residuesat P4 and P2, respectively, with a relatively relaxed acceptance of aminoacids at P1 and P3
synonyms: S1P endopeptidase|S1P protease|SKI-1|SREBP S1 protease|SREBP proteinase|SREBP-1 proteinase|SREBP-2 proteinase|mammalian subtilisin/kexin isozyme 1|membrane-bound transcription factor site-1 protease|proprotein convertase SKI-1|proprotein convertase SKI-1/S1PPS1|site-1 peptidase|sterol regulatory element-binding protein proteinase|sterol regulatory element-binding protein site 1 protease|sterol-regulated luminal protease|subtilase SKI-1|subtilase SKI-1/S1P|subtilisin/kexin isozyme 1

name: pestivirus NS3 polyprotein peptidase
definition: Leu is conserved at position P1 for all four cleavage sites. Alanine isfound at position P1' of the NS4A-NS4B cleavage site, whereas serine isfound at position P1' of the NS3-NS4A, NS4B-NS5A and NS5A-NS5B cleavagesites
synonyms: BDV NS3 endopeptidase|BVDV NS3 endopeptidase|CSFV NS3 endopeptidase|border disease virus NS3 endopeptidase|bovine viral diarrhea virus NS3 endopeptidase|classical swine fever virus NS3 endopeptidase

name: equine arterivirus serine peptidase
definition: Cleavage of (Glu/Gln)-|-(Gly/Ser/Ala) in arterivirus replicasetranslation products ORF1a and ORF1ab
synonyms: 3C-like Ser protease|3C-like serine protease|3CLSP|arterivirus NSP4|chymotrypsin-like serine proteinase nsp4|equine arteritis virus serine peptidase|non-structural protein 4 serine protease

name: infectious pancreatic necrosis birnavirus Vp4 peptidase
definition: Cleaves the (Ser/Thr)-Xaa-Ala-|-(Ser/Ala)-Gly motif in the polyproteinNH2-pVP2-VP4-VP3-COOH of infectious pancreatic necrosis virus at thepVP2-VP4 and VP4-VP3 junctions
synonyms: IPNV Vp4 peptidase|IPNV Vp4 protease|NS protease|NS-associated protease|Vp4 protease|infectious pancreatic necrosis virus protease

name: SpoIVB peptidase
definition: Self-cleaves 52-Val-|-Asn-53, 62-Ala-|-Phe-63 and 74-Val-|-Thr-75 at theN-terminus of SpoIVB
synonyms: sporulation factor IV B protease|stage IV sporulation protein B

name: stratum corneum chymotryptic enzyme
definition: Cleavage of proteins with aromatic side chains in the P1 position

name: kallikrein 8
definition: Cleavage of amide substrates following the basic amino acids Arg or Lysat the P1 position, with a preference for Arg over Lys

name: kallikrein 13
definition: Hydrolyzes mouse Ren2 protein (a species of prorenin present in thesubmandibular gland) on the carboxy side of the arginine residue at theLys-Arg-|- pair in the N-terminus, to yield mature renin
synonyms: PRECE|PRECE-1|epidermal growth factor-binding protein type B|mGK-13|prorenin converting enzyme 1|prorenin-converting enzyme|proteinase P

name: alpha-lytic endopeptidase
definition: Preferential cleavage: Ala-|-Xaa, Val-|-Xaa in bacterial cell walls,elastin and other proteins

name: oviductin
definition: Preferential cleavage at 371-Gly-Ser-Arg-|-Trp-374 of glycoprotein gp43in Xenopus laevis coelemic egg envelope to yield gp41

name: transmembrane protease serine 2
definition: The enzyme cleaves angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (EC 3.4.17.23) andcleaves influenzea A and B virus and coronavirus spike glycoproteins atarginine residues

name: kumamolysin
definition: The enzyme preferentially hydrolyzes peptides having an Ala or Proresidue at P2 position and prefers such charged amino acid residues asGlu or Arg at the P2' position. In the oxidized insulin B chain,kumamolysin preferentially cleaves between Leu(15) and Tyr(16)

name: glutamyl endopeptidase
synonyms: V8 proteinase|endoproteinase Glu-C|protease V8|staphylococcal serine proteinase

name: chymotrypsin C
definition: Preferential cleavage: Leu-|-Xaa, Tyr-|-Xaa, Phe-|-Xaa, Met-|-Xaa,Trp-|-Xaa, Gln-|-Xaa, Asn-|-Xaa

name: coagulation factor VIIa
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Ile bond in factor X to form factor Xa

name: coagulation factor IXa
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Ile bond in factor X to form factor Xa

name: cucumisin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity

name: prolyl oligopeptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of Pro-|-Xaa >> Ala-|-Xaa in oligopeptides

name: coagulation factor XIa
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Ala and Arg-|-Val bonds in factor IX to formfactor IXa

name: metridin
definition: Preferential cleavage: Tyr-|-Xaa, Phe-|-Xaa, Leu-|-Xaa. Little action onTrp-|-Xaa
synonyms: Metridium proteinase A|sea anemone protease A

name: brachyurin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, with broad specificity for peptide bonds. Nativecollagen is cleaved about 75% of the length of the molecule from theN-terminus. Low activity on small molecule substrates of both trypsin andchymotrypsin

name: plasma kallikrein
definition: Cleaves selectively Arg-|-Xaa and Lys-|-Xaa bonds, including Lys-|-Argand Arg-|-Ser bonds in (human) kininogen to release bradykinin

name: tissue kallikrein
definition: Preferential cleavage of Arg-|-Xaa bonds in small molecule substratesHighly selective action to release kallidin (lysyl-bradykinin) fromkininogen involves hydrolysis of Met-|-Xaa or Leu-|-Xaa

name: pancreatic elastase
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, including elastin. Preferential cleavage:Ala-|-Xaa

name: leukocyte elastase
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, including elastin. Preferential cleavage:Val-|-Xaa > Ala-|-Xaa
synonyms: bone marrow serine protease|lysosomal elastase|medullasin|neutrophil elastase

name: coagulation factor XIIa
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Ile bonds in factor VII to form factor VIIaand factor XI to form factor XIa

name: chymase
definition: Preferential cleavage: Phe-|-Xaa > Tyr-|-Xaa > Trp-|-Xaa > Leu-|-Xaa
synonyms: mast cell protease I|skeletal muscle (SK) protease

name: complement subcomponent C1r
definition: Selective cleavage of Lys(or Arg)-|-Ile bond in complement subcomponentC1s to form the active form of C1s (EC 3.4.21.42)

name: complement subcomponent C1s
definition: Cleavage of Arg-|-Ala bond in complement component C4 to form C4a andC4b, and Lys(or Arg)-|-Lys bond in complement component C2 to form C2aand C2b: the 'classical' pathway C3 convertase

name: classical-complement-pathway C3/C5 convertase
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Ser bond in complement component C3 alpha-chain to form C3a and C3b, and Arg-|-Xaa bond in complement component C5alpha-chain to form C5a and C5b

name: complement factor I
definition: Inactivates complement subcomponents C3b, iC3b and C4b by proteolyticcleavage
synonyms: C3b inactivator|C3b/C4b inactivator|complement component C3b inactivator

name: complement factor D
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Lys bond in complement factor B when incomplex with complement subcomponent C3b or with cobra venom factor

name: alternative-complement-pathway C3/C5 convertase
definition: Cleavage of Arg-|-Ser bond in complement component C3 alpha-chain toyield C3a and C3b, and Arg-|-Xaa bond in complement component C5 alpha-chain to yield C5a and C5b
synonyms: C3 convertase|C3 proactivator|C5 convertase|complement component C3/C5 convertase (alternative)|complement factor B|properdin factor B

name: cerevisin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity, and of Bz-Arg-OEt >Ac-Tyr-OEt. Does not hydrolyze peptide amides

name: hypodermin C
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins including native collagen at Xaa-|-Ala bondleaving an N-terminal (75%) and a C-terminal (25%) fragment

name: thrombin
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Gly bonds in fibrinogen to form fibrin andrelease fibrinopeptides A and B

name: lysyl endopeptidase
synonyms: Achromobacter proteinase I|lysyl bond specific proteinase

name: endopeptidase La
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins in presence of ATP

name: gamma-renin
definition: Cleavage of the Leu-|-Leu bond in synthetic tetradecapeptide reninsubstrate, to produce angiotensin I, but not active on naturalangiotensinogen. Also hydrolyzes Bz-Arg-p-nitroanilide

name: venombin AB
definition: Preferential cleavage: Arg-|-Xaa bonds in fibrinogen to form fibrin andrelease fibrinopeptides A and B

name: leucyl endopeptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins. Preferential cleavage: Leu-|-Xaa in smallmolecule substrates

name: tryptase
definition: Preferential cleavage: Arg-|-Xaa, Lys-|-Xaa, but with more restrictedspecificity than trypsin
synonyms: lung tryptase|mast cell protease II|mast cell tryptase|pituitary tryptase|skin tryptase

name: coagulation factor Xa
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Thr and then Arg-|-Ile bonds in prothrombinto form thrombin

name: scutelarin
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Thr and Arg-|-Ile in prothrombin to formthrombin and two inactive fragments

name: kexin
definition: Cleavage of -Lys-Arg-|-Xaa- and -Arg-Arg-|-Xaa- bonds to process yeastalpha-factor pheromone and killer toxin precursors
synonyms: paired-basic endopeptidase|prohormone-processing endoprotease|proteinase yscF|yeast KEX2 protease

name: subtilisin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds, and apreference for a large uncharged residue in P1. Hydrolyzes peptideamides

name: oryzin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity, and of Bz-Arg-OEt >Ac-Tyr-OEt. Does not hydrolyze peptide amides

name: peptidase K
definition: Hydrolysis of keratin, and of other proteins with subtilisin-likespecificity. Hydrolyzes peptide amides
synonyms: Tritirachium album proteinase K|Tritirachium alkaline proteinase|endopeptidase K|proteinase K

name: thermomycolin
definition: Rather non-specific hydrolysis of proteins. Preferential cleavage:-Ala-|-Xaa-, -Tyr-|-Xaa-, -Phe-|-Xaa- in small molecular substrates

name: endopeptidase So
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, but not Bz-Tyr-OEt, Ac-Phe-beta-naphthylester,or Bz-Arg-OEt

name: t-plasminogen activator
definition: Specific cleavage of Arg-|-Val bond in plasminogen to form plasmin

name: protein C (activated)
definition: Degradation of blood coagulation factors Va and VIIIa
synonyms: activated blood coagulation factor XIV|autoprothrombin IIA

name: plasmin
definition: Preferential cleavage: Lys-|-Xaa > Arg-|-Xaa, higher selectivity thantrypsin. Converts fibrin into soluble products

name: pancreatic endopeptidase E
definition: Preferential cleavage: Ala-|-Xaa. Does not hydrolyze elastin

name: pancreatic elastase II
definition: Preferential cleavage: Leu-|-Xaa, Met-|-Xaa and Phe-|-Xaa. Hydrolyzeselastin

name: IgA-specific serine endopeptidase
definition: Cleavage of immunoglobulin A molecules at certain Pro-|-Xaa bonds in thehinge region. No small molecule substrates are known

name: u-plasminogen activator
definition: Specific cleavage of Arg-|-Val bond in plasminogen to form plasmin

name: venombin A
definition: Selective cleavage of Arg-|-Xaa bond in fibrinogen, to form fibrin,and release fibrinopeptide A. The specificity of further degradation offibrinogen varies with species origin of the enzyme

name: furin
definition: Release of mature proteins from their proproteins by cleavage of -Arg-Xaa-Yaa-Arg-|-Zaa- bonds, where Xaa can be any amino acid and Yaa is Argor Lys. Releases albumin, complement component C3 and von Willebrandfactor from their respective precursors
synonyms: dibasic processing enzyme|paired basic amino acid residue cleaving enzyme|prohormone convertase

name: myeloblastin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, including elastin, by preferential cleavage:-Ala-|-Xaa- > -Val-|-Xaa-

name: granzyme A
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, including fibronectin, type IV collagen andnucleolin. Preferential cleavage: -Arg-|-Xaa-, -Lys-|-Xaa- >> -Phe-|-Xaa- in small molecule substrates

name: streptogrisin A
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with specificity similar to chymotrypsin

name: streptogrisin B
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with trypsin-like specificity

name: glutamyl endopeptidase II
definition: Preferential cleavage: -Glu-|-Xaa- >> -Asp-|-Xaa-. Preference for Pro orLeu at P2 and Phe at P3. Cleavage of -Glu-|-Asp- and -Glu-|-Pro- bonds isslow

name: oligopeptidase B
definition: Hydrolysis of -Arg-|-Xaa- and -Lys-|-Xaa- bonds in oligopeptides, evenwhen P1' residue is proline

name: limulus clotting factor C
definition: Selective cleavage of 103-Arg-|-Ser-104 and 124-Ile-|-Ile-125 bonds inLimulus clotting factor B to form activated factor B. Cleavage of -Pro-Arg-|-Xaa- bonds in synthetic substrates

name: limulus clotting factor B
definition: Selective cleavage of 98-Arg-|-Ile-99 bond in Limulus proclotting enzymeto form active clotting enzyme

name: limulus clotting enzyme
definition: Selective cleavage of 18-Arg-|- and 47-Arg-|- bonds in coagulogen to formcoagulin and fragments

name: repressor LexA
definition: Hydrolysis of Ala-|-Gly bond in repressor LexA

name: signal peptidase I
definition: Cleavage of hydrophobic, N-terminal signal or leader sequences fromsecreted and periplasmic proteins
synonyms: SPase I|bacterial leader peptidase I|phage-procoat-leader peptidase

name: enteropeptidase
definition: Activation of trypsinogen by selective cleavage of 6-Lys-|-Ile-7 bond

name: togavirin
definition: Autocatalytic release of the core protein from the N-terminus of thetogavirus structural polyprotein by hydrolysis of a -Trp-|-Ser- bond

name: flavivirin
definition: Selective hydrolysis of -Xaa-Xaa-|-Yaa- bonds in which each of the Xaacan be either Arg or Lys and Yaa can be either Ser or Ala

name: endopeptidase Clp
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins to small peptides in the presence of ATP andmagnesium. alpha-casein is the usual test substrate. In the absence ofATP, only oligopeptides shorter than five residues are hydrolyzed (suchas succinyl-Leu-Tyr-|-NHMec, and Leu-Tyr-Leu-|-Tyr-Trp, in which cleavageof the -Tyr-|-Leu- and -Tyr-|-Trp bonds also occurs)

name: proprotein convertase 1
definition: Release of protein hormones, neuropeptides and renin from theirprecursors, generally by hydrolysis of -Lys-Arg-|- bonds

name: proprotein convertase 2
definition: Release of protein hormones and neuropeptides from their precursors,generally by hydrolysis of -Lys-Arg-|- bonds

name: snake venom factor V activator
definition: Fully activates human clotting factor V by a single cleavage at the 1545-Trp-Tyr-Leu-Arg-|-Ser-Asn-Asn-Gly-1552 bond. Cattle, but not rabbit,factor V is cleaved, and no other proteins of the clotting system areattacked. Esterase activity is observed on Bz-Arg-OEt and Tos-Arg-OMe,and amidase activity on Phe-pipecolyl-Arg-NHPhNO2

name: lactocepin
definition: Endopeptidase activity with very broad specificity, although some subsitepreference have been noted, e.g. large hydrophobic residues in the P1 andP4 positions, and Pro in the P2 position. Best known for its action oncaseins, although it has been shown to hydrolyze hemoglobin and oxidizedinsulin B-chain
synonyms: extracellular lactococcal proteinase|lactococcal cell envelope-associated proteinase|wall-associated serine proteinase

name: assemblin
definition: Cleaves -Ala-|-Ser- and -Ala-|-Ala- bonds in the scaffold protein

name: hepacivirin
definition: Hydrolysis of four peptide bonds in the viral precursor polyprotein,commonly with Asp or Glu in the P6 position, Cys or Thr in P1 and Ser orAla in P1'
synonyms: Cpro-2|hepatitis C virus NS3 serine proteinase

name: spermosin
definition: Hydrolyzes arginyl bonds, preferably with Pro in the P2 position

name: cathepsin B
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bondsPreferentially cleaves -Arg-Arg-|-Xaa bonds in small molecule substrates(thus differing from cathepsin L). In addition to being an endopeptidase,shows peptidyl-dipeptidase activity, liberating C-terminal dipeptides

name: streptopain
definition: Preferential cleavage with hydrophobic residues at P2, P1 and P1'
synonyms: Streptococcus peptidase A|streptococcal cysteine proteinase|streptococcal proteinase

name: actinidain
definition: Specificity close to that of papain

name: cathepsin L
definition: Specificity close to that of papain. As compared to cathepsin B,cathepsin L exhibits higher activity toward protein substrates, but haslittle activity on Z-Arg-Arg-NHMec, and no peptidyl-dipeptidase activity

name: cathepsin H
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, acting as an aminopeptidase (notably, cleavingArg-|-Xaa bonds) as well as an endopeptidase

name: papain
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds,but preference for an amino acid bearing a large hydrophobic side chainat the P2 position. Does not accept Val in P1'

name: cathepsin T
definition: Interconversion of the three forms of EC 2.6.1.5

name: glycyl endopeptidase
definition: Preferential cleavage: Gly-|-Xaa, in proteins and in small moleculesubstrates

name: cancer procoagulant
definition: Specific cleavage of Arg-|-Ile bond in Factor X to form Factor Xa

name: cathepsin S
definition: Similar to cathepsin L, but with much less activity on Z-Phe-Arg-|-NHMec,and more activity on the Z-Val-Val-Arg-|-Xaa compound

name: picornain 3C
definition: Selective cleavage of Gln-|-Gly bond in the poliovirus polyprotein. Inother picornavirus reactions Glu may be substituted for Gln, and Ser orThr for Gly

name: picornain 2A
definition: Selective cleavage of Tyr-|-Gly bond in the picornavirus polyprotein

name: ficain
definition: Specificity similar to that of papain

name: caricain
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds, similarto those of papain and chymopapain
synonyms: papaya peptidase A|papaya peptidase II|papaya proteinase III|papaya proteinase Omega|papaya proteinase Q

name: ananain
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds. Bestreported small molecule substrate Bz-Phe-Val-Arg-|-NHMec, but broaderspecificity than fruit bromelain

name: stem bromelain
definition: Broad specificity for cleavage of proteins, but strong preference forZ-Arg-Arg-|-NHMec among small molecule substrates

name: fruit bromelain
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds. Bz-Phe-Val-Arg-|-NHMec is a good synthetic substrate, but there is no action onZ-Arg-Arg-|-NHMec (cf. stem bromelain)

name: legumain
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins and small molecule substrates at -Asn-|-Xaa- bonds

name: histolysain
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, including basement membrane collagen andazocasein. Preferential cleavage: Arg-Arg-|-Xaa in small moleculesubstrates including Z-Arg-Arg-|-NHMec

name: caspase-1
definition: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at position P1 and has a preferredcleavage sequence of Tyr-Val-Ala-Asp-|-
synonyms: interleukin 1beta converting enzyme|interleukin 1beta-converting endopeptidase|interleukin-1 beta convertase precursor|interleukin-1beta convertase|pro-interleukin 1beta proteinase|prointerleukin 1beta protease

name: gingipain R
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins and small molecule substrates, with a preferencefor Arg in P1

name: cathepsin K
definition: Broad proteolytic activity. With small-molecule substrates andinhibitors, the major determinant of specificity is P2, which ispreferably Leu, Met > Phe, and not Arg

name: adenain
definition: Cleaves proteins of the adenovirus and its host cell at two consensussites: -Yaa-Xaa-Gly-Gly-|-Xaa- and -Yaa-Xaa-Gly-Xaa-|-Gly- (in which Yaais Met, Ile or Leu, and Xaa is any amino acid)

name: bleomycin hydrolase
definition: Inactivates bleomycin B2 (a cytotoxic glycometallopeptide) by hydrolysisof a carboxyamide bond of beta-aminoalanine, but also shows generalaminopeptidase activity. The specificity varies somewhat with source,but amino acid arylamides of Met, Leu and Ala are preferred

name: cathepsin F
definition: The recombinant enzyme cleaves synthetic substrates with Phe and Leu(better than Val) in P2, with high specificity constant (kcat/Km)comparable to that of cathepsin L

name: cathepsin O
definition: The recombinant human enzyme hydrolyzes synthetic endopeptidasesubstrates including Z-Phe-Arg-NHMec and Z-Arg-Arg-NHMec

name: cathepsin V
definition: The recombinant enzyme hydrolyzes proteins (serum albumin, collagen) andsynthetic substrates (Z-Phe-Arg-NHMec > Z-Leu-Arg-NHMec > Z-Val-Arg-NHMec)

name: nuclear-inclusion-a endopeptidase
definition: Hydrolyzes glutaminyl bonds, and activity is further restricted bypreferences for the amino acids in P6 - P1' that vary with the species ofpotyvirus, e.g. Glu-Xaa-Xaa-Tyr-Xaa-Gln-|-(Ser or Gly) for the enzymefrom tobacco etch virus. The natural substrate is the viral polyprotein,but other proteins and oligopeptides containing the appropriate consensussequence are also cleaved

name: helper-component proteinase
definition: Hydrolyzes a Gly-|-Gly bond at its own C-terminus, commonly in thesequence -Tyr-Xaa-Val-Gly-|-Gly, in the processing of the potyviralpolyprotein

name: L-peptidase
definition: Autocatalytically cleaves itself from the polyprotein of the foot-and-mouth disease virus by hydrolysis of a Lys-|-Gly bond, but thencleaves host cell initiation factor eIF-4G at bonds -Gly-|-Arg- and-Lys-|-Arg-

name: gingipain K
definition: Endopeptidase with strict specificity for lysyl bonds

name: staphopain
definition: Broad endopeptidase action on proteins including elastin, but ratherlimited hydrolysis of small-molecule substrates. Assays are convenientlymade with hemoglobin, casein or Z-Phe-Arg-NHMec as substrate

name: separase
definition: All bonds known to be hydrolyzed by this endopeptidase have arginine inP1 and an acidic residue in P4. P6 is often occupied by an acidic residueor by a hydroxy-amino-acid residue, the phosphorylation of which enhancescleavage

name: V-cath endopeptidase
definition: Endopeptidase of broad specificity, hydrolyzing substrates of bothcathepsin L and cathepsin B

name: cruzipain
definition: Broad endopeptidase specificity similar to that of cathepsin L

name: calpain-3
synonyms: CANP 3|CAPN3|calcium-activated neutral proteinase 3|calpain L3|calpain p94|muscle-specific calcium-activated neutral protease 3

name: caspase-2
definition: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at P1, with 316-Asp being essentialfor proteolytic activity and has a preferred cleavage sequence of Val-Asp-Val-Ala-Asp-|-
synonyms: CASP-2|ICH-1|NEDD-2|NEDD2 protein|neural precursor cell expressed developmentally down-regulated protein 2

name: caspase-3
definition: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at positions P1 and P4. It has apreferred cleavage sequence of Asp-Xaa-Xaa-Asp-|- with a hydrophobicamino-acid residue at P2 and a hydrophilic amino-acid residue at P3,although Val or Ala are also accepted at this position

name: caspase-4
definition: Strict requirement for Asp at the P1 position. It has a preferredcleavage sequence of Tyr-Val-Ala-Asp-|- but also cleaves at Asp-Glu-Val-Asp-|-

name: caspase-5
definition: Strict requirement for Asp at the P1 position. It has a preferredcleavage sequence of Tyr-Val-Ala-Asp-|- but also cleaves at Asp-Glu-Val-Asp-|-

name: caspase-6
definition: Strict requirement for Asp at position P1 and has a preferred cleavagesequence of Val-Glu-His-Asp-|-

name: chymopapain
definition: Specificity similar to that of papain

name: caspase-7
definition: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at position P1 and has a preferredcleavage sequence of Asp-Glu-Val-Asp-|-

name: caspase-8
definition: Strict requirement for Asp at position P1 and has a preferred cleavagesequence of (Leu/Asp/Val)-Glu-Thr-Asp-|-(Gly/Ser/Ala)
synonyms: CAP4|CASP-8|FADD-homologous ICE/CED-3-like protease|FADD-like ICE|FLICE|ICE-like apoptotic protease 5|MACH|MORT1-associated CED-3 homolog|Mch5|apoptotic cysteine protease|apoptotic protease Mch-5|mammalian Ced-3 homolog 5

name: caspase-9
definition: Strict requirement for an Asp residue at position P1 and with a markedpreference for His at position P2. It has a preferred cleavage sequenceof Leu-Gly-His-Asp-|-Xaa
synonyms: APAF-3|CASP-9|ICE-LAP6|ICE-like apoptotic protease 6|apoptotic protease Mch-6|apoptotic protease-activating factor 3

name: caspase-10
definition: Strict requirement for Asp at position P1 and has a preferred cleavagesequence of Leu-Gln-Thr-Asp-|-Gly
synonyms: 2|CASP-10|FAS-associated death domain protein interleukin-1beta-converting enzyme|FLICE2|ICE-like apoptotic protease 4|Mch4|apoptotic protease Mch-4

name: caspase-11
definition: Strict requirement for Asp at the P1 position and has a preferredcleavage sequence of (Ile/Leu/Val/Phe)-Gly-His-Asp-|-

name: peptidase 1 (mite)
synonyms: allergen Der p 1|endopeptidase 1 (mite)|major mite fecal allergen Der p 1

name: calicivirin
definition: Endopeptidase with a preference for cleavage when the P1 position isoccupied by Glu-|-Xaa and the P1' position is occupied by Gly-|-Yaa
synonyms: Camberwell virus processing peptidase|Chiba virus processing peptidase|Norwalk virus processing peptidase|Southampton virus processing peptidase|calicivirus 3C-like protease|calicivirus TCP|calicivirus endopeptidase|calicivirus trypsin-like cysteine protease|norovirus virus processing peptidase|rabbit hemorrhagic disease virus 3C endopeptidase

name: zingipain
definition: Preferential cleavage of peptides with a proline residue at the P2position

name: Ulp1 peptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of the alpha-linked peptide bond in the sequence Gly-Gly-|-Ala-Thr-Tyr at the C-terminal end of the small ubiquitin-likemodifier (SUMO) propeptide, Smt3, leading to the mature form of theprotein. A second reaction involves the cleavage of an epsilon-linkedpeptide bond between the C-terminal glycine of the mature SUMO and thelysine epsilon-amino group of the target protein
synonyms: Smt3-protein conjugate proteinase|Ubl-specific protease 1|Ulp1|Ulp1 endopeptidase|Ulp1 protease

name: SARS coronavirus main proteinase
definition: TSAVLQ-|-SGFRK-NH2 and SGVTFQ-|-GKFKK the two peptides corresponding tothe two self-cleavage sites of the SARS 3C-like proteinase are the twomost reactive peptide substrates. The enzyme exhibits a strong preferencefor substrates containing Gln at P1 position and Leu at P2 position
synonyms: 3C-like protease|3cLpro|SARS coronavirus main protease|SARS-CoV 3CLpro enzyme|coronavirus 3C-like protease|severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus main protease

name: asclepain
definition: Specificity similar to that of papain

name: sortase A
definition: The enzyme catalyzes a cell wall sorting reaction in which a surfaceprotein with a sorting signal containing a LPXTG motif is cleaved betweenthe Thr and Gly residue. The resulting threonine carboxyl end of theprotein is covalently attached to a pentaglycine cross-bridge ofpeptidoglycan

name: sortase B
definition: The enzyme catalyzes a cell wall sorting reaction in which a surfaceprotein with a sorting signal containing a NPXTN motif is cleaved betweenthe Thr and Asn residue. The resulting threonine carboxyl end of theprotein is covalently attached to a pentaglycine cross-bridge ofpeptidoglycan

name: clostripain
definition: Preferential cleavage: Arg-|-Xaa, including Arg-|-Pro bond, but notLys-|-Xaa

name: pepsin A
definition: Preferential cleavage: hydrophobic, preferably aromatic, residues in P1and P1' positions. Cleaves 1-Phe-|-Val-2, 4-Gln-|-His-5, 13-Glu-|-Ala-14,14-Ala-|-Leu-15, 15-Leu-|-Tyr-16, 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17, 23-Gly-|-Phe-24,24-Phe-|-Phe-25 and 25-Phe-|-Tyr-26 bonds in the B chain of insulin

name: nepenthesin
definition: Similar to pepsin, but also cleaves on either side of Asp and atLys-|-Arg

name: renin
definition: Cleavage of Leu-|-Xaa bond in angiotensinogen to generate angiotensin I

name: HIV-1 retropepsin
definition: Specific for a P1 residue that is hydrophobic, and P1' variable,but often Pro

name: pro-opiomelanocortin converting enzyme
definition: Cleavage at paired basic residues in certain prohormones, either betweenthem, or on the carboxyl side

name: aspergillopepsin I
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity. Generally favorshydrophobic residues in P1 and P1', but also accepts Lys in P1, whichleads to activation of trypsinogen. Does not clot milk
synonyms: Protease type XIII|aspergillopepsin A|aspergillopepsin F|aspergillopeptidase A|awamorin|proctase B|proteinase B|trypsinogen kinase

name: aspergillopepsin II
definition: Preferential cleavage in B chain of insulin: 3-Asn-|-Gln-4, 13-Gly-|-Ala-14, and 26-Tyr-|-Thr-27
synonyms: Aspergillus niger var. macrosporus aspartic proteinase|proctase A|proteinase A

name: pepsin B
definition: Degradation of gelatin, little activity on hemoglobin. Specificity on Bchain of insulin more restricted than that of pepsin A. Does not cleave1-Phe-|-Val-2, 4-Gln-|-His-5 or 23-Gly-|-Phe-24

name: penicillopepsin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity similar to that of pepsinA, preferring hydrophobic residues at P1 and P1', but also cleaving20-Gly-|-Glu-21 in the B chain of insulin. Clots milk, and activatestrypsinogen

name: rhizopuspepsin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity similar to that of pepsinA, preferring hydrophobic residues at P1 and P1'. Clots milk andactivates trypsinogen. Does not cleave 4-Gln-|-His-5, but does cleave10-His-|-Leu-11 and 12-Val-|-Glu-13 in B chain of insulin

name: endothiapepsin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with specificity similar to that of pepsin A,prefers hydrophobic residues at P1 and P1', but does not cleave14-Ala-|-Leu-15 in the B chain of insulin or Z-Glu-Tyr. Clots milk

name: mucorpepsin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, favoring hydrophobic residues at P1 and P1'Clots milk. Does not accept Lys at P1, and hence does not activatetrypsinogen

name: candidapepsin
definition: Preferential cleavage at the carboxyl of hydrophobic amino acids,but fails to cleave 15-Leu-|-Tyr-16, 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 and 24-Phe-|-Phe-25of insulin B chain. Activates trypsinogen, and degrades keratin

name: saccharopepsin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity for peptide bonds. Cleaves-Leu-Leu-|-Val-Tyr- bond in a synthetic substrate. Does not act on estersof Tyr or Arg

name: rhodotorulapepsin
definition: Specificity similar to that of pepsin A. Cleaves Z-Lys-|-Ala-Ala-Ala andactivates trypsinogen

name: acrocylindropepsin
definition: Preference for hydrophobic residue at P1 and P1'. Action on the B chainof insulin is generally similar to that of pepsin A, but it also cleaves6-Leu-|-Cys(SO3H)-7, 21-Glu-|-Arg-22 and 3-Asn-|-Gln-4, although not4-Gln-|-His-5

name: polyporopepsin
definition: Milk clotting activity, broad specificity, but fails to cleave15-Leu-|-Tyr-16 or 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 of insulin B chain

name: gastricsin
definition: More restricted specificity than pepsin A, but shows preferentialcleavage at Tyr-|-Xaa bonds. High activity on hemoglobin

name: pycnoporopepsin
definition: Specificity similar to pepsin A, but narrower, cleaving only three bondsin the B chain of insulin: 14-Ala-|-Leu-15, 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17,and 24-Phe-|-Phe-25

name: scytalidopepsin A
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with specificity similar to that of pepsin A,but also cleaves 7-Cys(SO3H)-|-Gly-8 and 17-Leu-|-Val-18 in the B chainof insulin

name: scytalidopepsin B
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins with broad specificity, cleaving 24-Phe-|-Phe-25,but not 15-Leu-|-Tyr-16 and 25-Phe-|-Tyr-26 in the B chain of insulin

name: cathepsin E
definition: Similar to cathepsin D, but slightly broader specificity

name: barrierpepsin
definition: Selective cleavage of 6-Leu-|-Lys-7 bond in the pheromone alpha-matingfactor

name: signal peptidase II
definition: Release of signal peptides from bacterial membrane prolipoproteinsHydrolyzes -Xaa-Yaa-Zaa-|-(S,diacylglyceryl)Cys-, in which Xaa ishydrophobic (preferably Leu), and Yaa (Ala or Ser) and Zaa (Gly or Ala)have small, neutral side chains
synonyms: SPase II|bacterial leader peptidase I|lipoprotein signal peptidase|premurein-leader peptidase|prolipoprotein-signal peptidase

name: plasmepsin I
definition: Hydrolysis of the 33-Phe-|-Leu-34 bond in the alpha-chain of hemoglobin,leading to denaturation of molecule

name: plasmepsin II
definition: Hydrolysis of the bonds linking certain hydrophobic residues inhemoglobin or globin. Also cleaves small molecules substrates such asAla-Leu-Glu-Arg-Thr-Phe-|-Phe(NO2)-Ser-Phe-Pro-Thr

name: chymosin
definition: Broad specificity similar to that of pepsin A. Clots milk by cleavage ofa single 104-Ser-Phe-|-Met-Ala-107 bond in kappa-chain of casein

name: phytepsin
definition: Prefers hydrophobic residues Phe, Val, Ile, Leu, and Ala at P1 and P1',but also cleaves -Phe-|-Asp- and -Asp-|-Asp- bonds in 2S albumin fromplant seeds

name: yapsin 1
definition: Hydrolyzes various precursor proteins with Arg or Lys in P1, and commonlyArg or Lys also in P2. The P3 amino acid is usually non-polar,but otherwise additional basic amino acids are favorable in both non-prime and prime positions

name: thermopsin
definition: Specificity similar to pepsin A, prefers bulky hydrophobic side-chains oneither side of the scissible bond

name: prepilin peptidase
definition: Typically cleaves a -Gly-|-Phe- bond to release an N-terminal, basicpeptide of 5-8 residues from type IV prepilin, and then N-methylates thenew N-terminal amino group, the methyl donor being S-adenosyl-L-methionine

name: nodavirus endopeptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of an asparaginyl bond involved in the maturation of thestructural protein of the virus, typically -Asn-|-Ala- or -Asn-|-Phe-
synonyms: Black Beetle virus endopeptidase|Flock House virus endopeptidase

name: memapsin 1
definition: Broad endopeptidase specificity. Cleaves Glu-Val-Asn-Leu-|-Asp-Ala-Glu-Phe in the Swedish variant of Alzheimer's amyloid precursor protein
synonyms: ASP1|BACE2|Down region aspartic protease|beta-secretase|beta-site APP-cleaving enzyme 2|beta-site Alzheimer's amyloid precursor protein cleaving enzyme 2|membrane-associated aspartic protease 1

name: memapsin 2
definition: Broad endopeptidase specificity. Cleaves Glu-Val-Asn-Leu-|-Asp-Ala-Glu-Phe in the Swedish variant of Alzheimer's amyloid precursor protein
synonyms: BACE1|beta-secretase|beta-site APP-cleaving enzyme 1|beta-site Alzheimer's amyloid precursor protein cleaving enzyme 1|membrane-associated aspartic protease 2

name: HIV-2 retropepsin
definition: Endopeptidase for which the P1 residue is preferably hydrophobic

name: plasminogen activator Pla
definition: Converts human Glu-plasminogen to plasmin by cleaving the 560-Arg-|-Val-561 peptide bond that is also hydrolyzed by the mammalian u-plasminogenactivator and t-plasminogen activator. Also cleaves arginyl bonds inother proteins

name: omptin
definition: Has a virtual requirement for Arg in the P1 position and a slightly lessstringent preference for this residue in the P1' position, which can alsocontain Lys, Gly or Val

name: cathepsin D
definition: Specificity similar to, but narrower than, that of pepsin A. Does notcleave the 4-Gln-|-His-5 bond in B chain of insulin

name: human endogenous retrovirus K endopeptidase
definition: Processing at the authentic HIV-1 PR recognition site and release of themature p17 matrix and the p24 capsid protein, as a result of the cleavageof the -SQNY-|-PIVQ- cleavage site
synonyms: HERV K10 endopeptidase|HERV K10 retropepsin|human endogenous retrovirus K10 endopeptidase|human endogenous retrovirus K113 protease|human retrovirus K10 retropepsin

name: HycI peptidase
definition: This enzyme specifically removes a 32-amino acid peptide from theC-terminus of the precursor of the large subunit of E.coli hydrogenase 3by cleavage at the C-terminal side of Arg-537

name: preflagellin peptidase
definition: Cleaves the signal peptide of 3 to 12 amino acids from the N-terminal ofpreflagellin, usually at Arg-Gly-|- or Lys-Gly-|-, to release flagellin

name: atrolysin A
definition: Cleavage of 3-Asn-|-Gln-4, 5-His-|-Leu-6, 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 in insulin B chain. Removes C-terminal Leu fromsmall peptides
synonyms: Crotalus atrox alpha-proteinase|Crotalus atrox metalloproteinase|hemorrhagic toxin a

name: neprilysin
definition: Preferential cleavage of polypeptides between hydrophobic residues,particularly with Phe or Tyr at P1'

name: envelysin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins of the fertilization envelope and dimethylcasein

name: IgA-specific metalloendopeptidase
definition: Cleavage of Pro-|-Thr bond in the hinge region of the heavy chain ofhuman IgA

name: procollagen N-endopeptidase
definition: Cleaves the N-propeptide of collagen chain alpha1(I) at Pro-|-Gln and ofalpha1(II) and alpha2(I) at Ala-|-Gln

name: thimet oligopeptidase
definition: Preferential cleavage of bonds with hydrophobic residues at P1, P2 andP3' and a small residue at P1' in substrates of 5 to 15 residues

name: stromelysin 1
definition: Preferential cleavage where P1', P2' and P3' are hydrophobic residues

name: meprin A
definition: Hydrolysis of protein and peptide substrates preferentially on carboxylside of hydrophobic residues

name: procollagen C-endopeptidase
definition: Cleavage of the C-terminal propeptide at Ala-|-Asp in type I and IIprocollagens and at Arg-|-Asp in type III

name: peptidyl-Lys metalloendopeptidase
definition: Preferential cleavage in proteins: -Xaa-|-Lys- (in which Xaa may be Pro)

name: astacin
definition: Hydrolysis of peptide bonds in substrates containing five or more aminoacids, preferentially with Ala in P1', and Pro in P2'

name: stromelysin 2
definition: Similar to stromelysin 1, but action on collagen types III, IV and V isweak

name: matrilysin
definition: Cleavage of 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 in B chain of insulin. Noaction on collagen types I, II, IV, V. Cleaves gelatin chain alpha2(I) >alpha1(I)

name: gelatinase A
definition: Cleavage of gelatin type I and collagen types IV, V, VII, X. Cleaves thecollagen-like sequence Pro-Gln-Gly-|-Ile-Ala-Gly-Gln

name: vibriolysin
definition: Preferential cleavage of bonds with bulky hydrophobic groups in P2 andP1'. Phe at P1' is the most favored residue, which distinguished thisenzyme from thermolysin

name: pseudolysin
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins including elastin, collagen types III and IV,fibronectin and immunoglobulin A, generally with bulky hydrophobic groupat P1'. Insulin B chain cleavage pattern identical to that ofthermolysin, but specificity differs in other respects

name: bacillolysin
definition: Similar, but not identical, to that of thermolysin

name: aureolysin
definition: Cleavage of insulin B chain with specificity similar to that ofthermolysin, preferring hydrophobic P1' residues. Activates the glutamylendopeptidase (EC 3.4.21.19) of Staphylococcus aureus

name: microbial collagenase
definition: Digestion of native collagen in the triple helical region at Xaa-|-Glybonds. With synthetic peptides, a preference is shown for Gly at P3 andP1', Pro and Ala at P2 and P2', and hydroxyproline, Ala or Arg at P3'
synonyms: Clostridium histolyticum collagenase|clostridiopeptidase A|collagenase A|collagenase I

name: coccolysin
definition: Preferential cleavage: Xaa-|-Leu, Xaa-|-Phe, Xaa-|-Tyr, Xaa-|-Ala

name: mycolysin
definition: Preferential cleavage of bonds with hydrophobic residues in P1'

name: beta-lytic metalloendopeptidase
definition: Cleavage of N-acetylmuramoyl-|-Ala, and of the insulin B chain at23-Gly-|-Phe-24 > 18-Val-|-Cys(SO3H)

name: peptidyl-Asp metalloendopeptidase
definition: Cleavage of Xaa-|-Asp, Xaa-|-Glu and Xaa-|-cysteic acid bonds

name: neutrophil collagenase
definition: Cleavage of interstitial collagens in the triple helical domain. UnlikeEC 3.4.24.7, this enzyme cleaves type III collagen more slowly than typeI

name: gelatinase B
definition: Cleavage of gelatin types I and V and collagen types IV and V
synonyms: 92-kDa gelatinase|92-kDa type IV collagenase|macrophage gelatinase|matrix metalloproteinase 9|type V collagenase

name: leishmanolysin
definition: Preference for hydrophobic residues at P1 and P1' and basic residues atP2' and P3'. A model nonapeptide is cleaved at -Ala-Tyr-|-Leu-Lys-Lys-

name: saccharolysin
definition: Cleavage of Pro-|-Phe and Ala-|-Ala bonds
synonyms: oligopeptidase yscD|proteinase yscD|yeast cysteine proteinase D

name: gametolysin
definition: Cleavage of the proline- and hydroxyproline-rich proteins of theChlamydomonas cell wall. Also cleaves azocasein, gelatin and Leu-Trp-Met-|-Arg-Phe-Ala
synonyms: Chlamydomonas cell wall degrading protease|autolysin|gamete lytic enzyme|lysin

name: deuterolysin
definition: Preferential cleavage of bonds with hydrophobic residues in P1'. Also3-Asn-|-Gln-4 and 8-Gly-|-Ser-9 bonds in insulin B chain
synonyms: Penicillium roqueforti protease II|acid metalloproteinase|microbial neutral proteinase II

name: serralysin
definition: Preferential cleavage of bonds with hydrophobic residues in P1'
synonyms: Escherichia freundii proteinase|Pseudomonas aeruginosa alkaline protease|Serratia marcescens extracellular proteinase

name: atrolysin B
definition: Cleavage of 5-His-|-Leu-6, 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15,16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 and 23-Gly-|-Phe-24 of insulin B chain. Identical to thecleavage of insulin B chain by atrolysin C. Also cleaves Xaa-|-Ser bondsin glucagon
synonyms: Crotalus atrox metalloendopeptidase b|Ht-b|hemorrhagic toxin b

name: atrolysin C
definition: Cleavage of 5-His-|-Leu-6, 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15,16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 and 23-Gly-|-Phe-24 of insulin B chain. With smallmolecule substrates prefers hydrophobic residue at P2' and small residuesuch as Ala, Gly at P1
synonyms: Crotalus atrox metalloendopeptidase c|Ht-c|hemorrhagic toxin c

name: atroxase
definition: Cleavage of 5-His-|-Leu-6, 9-Ser-|-His-10, 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 in insulin B chain

name: atrolysin E
definition: Cleavage of 3-Asn-|-Gln-4, 9-Ser-|-His-10 and 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 bonds ininsulin B chain and 14-Tyr-|-Gln-15 and 8-Thr-|-Ser-9 in A chain. Cleavestype IV collagen at 73-Ala-|-Gln-74 in alpha1-(IV) and at 7-Gly-|-Leu-8in alpha2-(IV)
synonyms: Crotalus atrox metalloendopeptidase e|hemorrhagic toxin e

name: atrolysin F
definition: Cleavage of 2-Val-|-Asn-3, 4-Gln-|-His-5, 6-Leu-|-Cys-7, 10-His-|-Leu-11,14-Ala-|-Leu-15 and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 bonds in insulin B chain
synonyms: Crotalus atrox metalloendopeptidase f|hemorrhagic toxin f

name: adamalysin
definition: Cleavage of 1-Phe-|-Val-2, 5-His-|-Leu-6, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15, 15-Leu-|-Tyr-16, and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 of insulin B chain
synonyms: Crotalus adamanteus metalloendopeptidase|proteinase I and II

name: horrilysin
definition: Cleavage of only the single bond 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 in the insulin B chain,12-Ser-|-Leu-13 in the A chain, and Ile-|-Gly, Pro-|-Ala, and Ser-|-Trpin mellitin

name: ruberlysin
definition: Cleavage of 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15, 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 and23-Gly-|-Phe-24 bonds of the B chain of insulin, His-|-Pro, Pro-|-Phe,and Trp-|-Ser of angiotensin I, and Gly-|-Phe of Met enkephalin
synonyms: Crotalus ruber metalloendopeptidase II|hemorrhagic metalloproteinase HT-2|hemorrhagic toxin II

name: bothropasin
definition: Cleavage of 5-His-|-Leu-6, 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15,16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 and 24-Phe-|-Phe-25 in insulin B chain

name: bothrolysin
definition: Cleavage of 4-Gln-|-His-5, 9-Ser-|-His-10 and 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 of insulinB chain and Pro-|-Phe of angiotensin I

name: ophiolysin
definition: Cleavage of 3-Asn-|-Gln-4, 4-Gln-|-His-5, 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15, and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 in insulin B chain

name: trimerelysin I
definition: Cleavage of only two bonds: 10-His-|-Leu-11 and 14-Ala-|-Leu-15, in theinsulin B chain

name: trimerelysin II
definition: Cleavage of 3-Asn-|-Gln-4, 10-His-|-Leu-11 and 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 in theinsulin B chain, and the bond Z-Gly-Pro-|-Leu-Gly-Pro in a small moleculesubstrate of microbial collagenase

name: mucrolysin
definition: Cleavage of 9-Ser-|-His-10, 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15,15-Leu-|-Tyr-16 and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 bonds in the insulin B chain

name: pitrilysin
definition: Preferential cleavage of 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 and 25-Phe-|-Tyr-26 bonds ofoxidized insulin B chain. Also acts on other substrates of Mw less than 7kDa such as insulin and glucagon

name: insulysin
definition: Degradation of insulin, glucagon and other polypeptides. No action onproteins

name: O-sialoglycoprotein endopeptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of O-sialoglycoproteins. Cleaves 31-Arg-|-Asp-32 bond inglycophorin A. Does not cleave unglycosylated proteins, desialylatedglycoproteins or glycoproteins that are only N-glycosylated

name: russellysin
definition: Specifically activates several components of the blood clotting system,including coagulation factor X, coagulation factor IX and protein C bycleavage of Arg-|-Xaa bonds. Has no action on insulin B chain
synonyms: RVV-X|Russell's viper venom factor X activator|blood-coagulation factor X-activating enzyme

name: mitochondrial intermediate peptidase
definition: Release of an N-terminal octapeptide as second stage of processing ofsome proteins imported into the mitochondrion

name: leucolysin
definition: Cleavage of 1-Phe-|-Val-2, 5-His-|-Leu-6, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15, 20-Gly-|-Glu-21, 23-Gly-|-Phe-24 and 24-Phe-|-Phe-25 bonds in insulin B chain as wellas N-blocked dipeptides

name: dactylysin
definition: Hydrolysis of peptides of at least six residues, with bulky hydrophobicresidues in the P1' position. Shows a preference for hydrophobic doubletssuch as -Phe-|-Phe- and -Phe-|-Leu- in somatostatin-(1-14)-peptide anddynorphin A-(1-6)-peptide, respectively

name: nardilysin
definition: Hydrolysis of polypeptides, preferably at -Xaa-|-Arg-Lys-, and lesscommonly at -Arg-|-Arg-Xaa-, in which Xaa is not Arg or Lys

name: magnolysin
definition: Hydrolysis of polypeptides with Arg or Lys in P1 and P2, e.g. tohydrolyze pro-oxytocin at -Lys-Arg-|-Ala-Val-. The specificity furtherdepends on the organization of a beta-turn-alpha-helix of nine or moreresidues containing the paired basic amino acids near the center

name: meprin B
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, including azocasein, and peptides. Hydrolysis of5-His-|-Leu-6, 6-Leu-|-Cys-7, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 and 19-Cys-|-Gly-20 bondsin insulin B chain

name: mitochondrial processing peptidase
definition: Release of N-terminal transit peptides from precursor proteins importedinto the mitochondrion, typically with Arg in position P2

name: macrophage elastase
definition: Hydrolysis of soluble and insoluble elastin. Specific cleavages are alsoproduced at 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 and 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 in the B chain ofinsulin

name: choriolysin L
definition: Hydrolysis of the inner layer of fish egg envelope. Also hydrolysis ofcasein and small molecule substrates such as succinyl-Leu-Leu-Val-Tyr-|-7-(4-methyl)coumarylamide

name: choriolysin H
definition: Hydrolysis of the inner layer of fish egg envelope. Also hydrolysis ofcasein and small molecule substrates such as succinyl-Leu-Leu-Val-Tyr-|-7-(4-methyl)coumarylamide

name: bontoxilysin
definition: Limited hydrolysis of proteins of the neuroexocytosis apparatus,synaptobrevins, SNAP25 or syntaxin. No detected action on small moleculesubstrates

name: interstitial collagenase
definition: Cleavage of the triple helix of collagen at about three-quarters of thelength of the molecule from the N-terminus, at 775-Gly-|-Ile-776 in thealpha1(I) chain. Cleaves synthetic substrates and alpha-macroglobulins atbonds where P1' is a hydrophobic residue

name: oligopeptidase A
definition: Hydrolysis of oligopeptides, with broad specificity. Gly or Ala commonlyoccur as P1 or P1' residues, but more distant residues are alsoimportant, as is shown by the fact that Z-Gly-Pro-Gly-|-Gly-Pro-Ala iscleaved, but not Z-(Gly)(5)

name: endothelin-converting enzyme 1
definition: Hydrolysis of the 21-Trp-|-Val-22 bond in big endothelin to formendothelin 1

name: fibrolase
definition: Hydrolysis of 14-Ala-|-Leu-15 in insulin B chain and 413-Lys-|-Leu-414 inalpha-chain of fibrinogen

name: jararhagin
definition: Cleavage of 10-His-|-Leu-11, 14-Ala-|-Leu-15, 16-Tyr-|-Leu-17 and24-Phe-|-Phe-25 bonds in insulin B chain

name: fragilysin
definition: Broad proteolytic specificity, bonds hydrolyzed includes -Gly-|-Leu-,-Met-|-Leu-, -Phe-|-Leu-, -Cys-|-Leu-, -Leu-|-Gly-

name: lysostaphin
definition: Hydrolysis of the -Gly-|-Gly- bond in the pentaglycine inter-peptide linkjoining staphylococcal cell wall peptidoglycans

name: flavastacin
definition: Hydrolyzes polypeptides on the amino-side of Asp in -Xaa-|-Asp-. Actsvery slowly on -Xaa-|-Glu

name: snapalysin
definition: Hydrolyzes proteins with a preference for Tyr or Phe in the P1' positionHas no action on amino-acid p-nitroanilides

name: GPR endopeptidase
definition: Endopeptidase action with P4 Glu or Asp, P1 preferably Glu > Asp,P1' hydrophobic and P2' Ala

name: pappalysin-1
definition: Cleavage of the 135-Met-|-Lys-136 bond in insulin-like growth factorbinding protein (IGFBP)-4, and the 143-Ser-|-Lys-144 bond in IGFBP-5
synonyms: insulin-like growth factor binding protein-4 protease|pregnancy-associated plasma protein-A

name: membrane-type matrix metalloproteinase-1
definition: Endopeptidase activity. Activates progelatinase A by cleavage of thepropeptide at 37-Asn-|-Leu-38. Other bonds hydrolyzed include35-Gly-|-Ile-36 in the propeptide of collagenase 3, and 341-Asn-|-Phe-342, 441-Asp-|-Leu-442 and 354-Gln-|-Thr-355 in the aggrecaninterglobular domain

name: ADAMTS-4 endopeptidase
definition: Glutamyl endopeptidase. Bonds cleaved include 370-Thr-Glu-Gly-Glu-|-Ala-Arg-Gly-Ser-377 in the interglobular domain of mammalian aggrecan

name: anthrax lethal factor endopeptidase
definition: Preferred amino acids around the cleavage site can be denotedBBBBxHx-|-H, in which B denotes Arg or Lys, H denotes a hydrophobic aminoacid, and x is any amino acid. The only known protein substrates aremitogen-activated protein (MAP) kinase kinases

name: Ste24 endopeptidase
definition: Hydrolyzes the peptide bond -P2-(S-farnesyl orgeranylgeranyl)C-P1'-P2'-P3'-COOH where P1' and P2' are amino acids withaliphatic side chains and P3' is any C-terminal residue

name: S2P endopeptidase
definition: Cleaves several transcription factors that are type-2 transmembraneproteins within membrane-spanning domains. Known substrates includesterol regulatory element-binding protein (SREBP) -1, SREBP-2 and formsof the transcriptional activator ATF6. SREBP-2 is cleaved at the site477-DRSRILL-|-CVLTFLCLSFNPLTSLLQWGGA-505. The residues Asn-Pro,11 residues distal to the site of cleavage in the membrane-spanningdomain, are important for cleavage by S2P endopeptidase. Replacement ofeither of these residues does not prevent cleavage, but there is nocleavage if both of these residues are replaced
synonyms: membrane-bound transcription factor site 2 protease|site-2 protease|sterol-regulatory element-binding proteins intramembrane protease

name: ADAM 17 endopeptidase
definition: Narrow endopeptidase specificity. Cleaves Pro-Leu-Ala-Gln-Ala-|-Val-Arg-Ser-Ser-Ser in the membrane-bound, 26-kDa form of tumor necrosisfactor alpha (TNFalpha). Similarly cleaves other membrane-anchored, cell-surface proteins to 'shed' the extracellular domains

name: ADAMTS13 endopeptidase
definition: The enzyme cleaves the von Willebrand factor at bond 842-Tyr-|-Met-843within the A2 domain
synonyms: ADAMTS VWF cleaving metalloprotease|ADAMTS13 peptidase|Upshaw factor|vWF-cleaving protease|vWF-degrading protease|von Willebrand factor cleaving protease

name: Pro-Pro endopeptidase
definition: The enzyme catalyzes the hydrolytic cleavage of peptide bonds between twoproline residues

name: proteasome endopeptidase complex
definition: Cleavage of peptide bonds with very broad specificity

name: HslU--HslV peptidase
definition: ATP-dependent cleavage of peptide bonds with broad specificity

name: intramembrane prenyl-peptidase Rce1
definition: Hydrolyzes the peptide bond -P2-(S-farnesyl orgeranylgeranyl)C-P1'-P2'-P3'-COOH where P1' and P2' are amino acids withaliphatic sidechains and P3' is any C-terminal residue

name: scytalidoglutamic peptidase
definition: Hydrolysis of proteins, with a strong preference for Phe or Tyr atposition P1 and one of the smaller amino-acids at P1' in the sequence -P3 - P2 - P1 -|-P1'- P2'- P3'-. Cleaves the Tyr(26)-Thr(27) bond in the Bchain of oxidized insulin, which is not cleaved by pepsin

name: Acting on carbon-nitrogen bonds, other than peptide bonds
peptidoglycan-N-acetylglucosamine deacetylase
synonyms: N-acetylglucosamine deacetylase|peptidoglycan GlcNAc deacetylase|peptidoglycan N-acetylglucosamine deacetylase|peptidoglycan deacetylase

name: chitin disaccharide deacetylase
synonyms: chitin oligosaccharide amidohydolase|chitin oligosaccharide deacetylase|chitobiose amidohydolase

name: sphingomyelin deacylase

definition: (1) D-threonine = acetaldehyde + glycine(2) D-allo-threonine = acetaldehyde + glycine

name: (S)-hydroxynitrile lyase

name: low-specificity L-threonine aldolase
definition: (1) L-threonine = acetaldehyde + glycine(2) L-allo-threonine = acetaldehyde + glycine

name: 2-hydroxyacyl-CoA lyase
definition: (1) a 2-hydroxy-3-methyl fatty acyl-CoA = a 2-methyl-branched fattyaldehyde + formyl-CoA(2) an (R)-2-hydroxy-long-chain-fatty acyl-CoA = a long-chain fattyaldehyde + formyl-CoA

name: indole-3-glycerol-phosphate lyase

name: phosphoketolase
definition: D-xylulose 5-phosphate + phosphate = acetyl phosphate + D-glyceraldehyde3-phosphate + H2O

name: tRNA 4-demethylwyosine synthase (AdoMet-dependent)

name: spore photoproduct lyase

definition: an aliphatic primary amide = an aliphatic nitrile + H2O
