definition: (1) (6S)-NADHX + ATP = ADP + phosphate + NADH + H(+)(2) (6S)-NADPHX + ATP = ADP + phosphate + NADPH + H(+)

name: pectin lyase
definition: Eliminative cleavage of (1->4)-alpha-D-galacturonan methyl ester to giveoligosaccharides with 4-deoxy-6-O-methyl-alpha-D-galact-4-enuronosylgroups at their non-reducing ends

name: guluronate-specific alginate lyase
definition: Eliminative cleavage of alginate to give oligosaccharides with 4-deoxy-alpha-L-erythro-hex-4-enuronosyl groups at their non-reducing ends andalpha-L-guluronate at their reducing end

name: xanthan lyase

name: anhydrosialidase

name: levan fructotransferase (DFA-IV-forming)

name: inulin fructotransferase (DFA-I-forming)

name: inulin fructotransferase (DFA-III-forming)
definition: Produces alpha-D-fructofuranose beta-D-fructofuranose1,2':2,3'-dianhydride (DFA III) by successively eliminating thediminishing (2->1)-beta-D-fructan (inulin) chain from the terminalD-fructosyl-D-fructosyl disaccharide
synonyms: 1,2':2,3'-dianhydride-forming)|beta-D-fructofuranose 1,2':2,3'-dianhydride)|forming)|inulase II|inulin D-fructosyl-D-fructosyltransferase (1,2':2,3'-dianhydride-|inulin D-fructosyl-D-fructosyltransferase (forming alpha-D-fructofuranose|inulin fructotransferase (DFA-III-producing)|inulin fructotransferase (depolymerizing)|inulin fructotransferase (depolymerizing, difructofuranose-|inulinase II

name: pectate lyase

synonyms: ChS ABC lyase|ChS ABC lyase I|chondroitin ABC eliminase|chondroitin ABC lyase|chondroitin sulfate ABC endoeliminase|chondroitin sulfate ABC endolyase|chondroitin sulfate ABC lyase|chondroitinase|chondroitinase ABC

name: chondroitin-sulfate-ABC exolyase

synonyms: ChS ABC lyase|ChS ABC lyase II|chondroitin ABC eliminase|chondroitin ABC lyase|chondroitin sulfate ABC exoeliminase|chondroitin sulfate ABC exolyase|chondroitin sulfate ABC lyase|chondroitinase|chondroitinase ABC

name: pectate trisaccharide-lyase

name: rhamnogalacturonan endolyase
definition: Endotype eliminative cleavage of L-alpha-rhamnopyranosyl-(1->4)-alpha-D-galactopyranosyluronic acid bonds of rhamnogalacturonan I domains inramified hairy regions of pectin leaving L-rhamnopyranose at the reducingend and 4-deoxy-4,5-unsaturated D-galactopyranosyluronic acid at the non-reducing end

name: rhamnogalacturonan exolyase
definition: Exotype eliminative cleavage of alpha-L-rhamnopyranosyl-(1->4)-alpha-D-galactopyranosyluronic acid bonds of rhamnogalacturonan Ioligosaccharides containing alpha-L-rhamnopyranose at the reducing endand 4-deoxy-4,5-unsaturated D-galactopyranosyluronic acid at the non-reducing end. The products are the disaccharide 2-O-(4-deoxy-beta-L-threo-hex-4-enopyranuronosyl)-alpha-L-rhamnopyranose and the shortenedrhamnogalacturonan oligosaccharide containing one 4-deoxy-4,5-unsaturatedD-galactopyranosyluronic acid at the non-reducing end

name: gellan lyase

The tetrasaccharide produced from deacetylated gellanis beta-D-4-deoxy-Delta(4)-GlcAp-(1->4)-beta-D-Glcp-(1->4)-alpha-L-Rhap-(1->3)-beta-D-Glcp

name: peptidoglycan lytic transglycosylase

synonyms: endolytic murein transglycosylase|endolytic transglycosylase|lytic murein transglycosylase|lytic transglycosylase

name: mannuronate-specific alginate lyase

synonyms: alginate lyase I|poly(beta-D-mannuronate) lyase|poly(mana) alginate lyase

name: chondroitin AC lyase
definition: Eliminative degradation of polysaccharides containing 1,4-beta-D-hexosaminyl and 1,3-beta-D-glucuronosyl linkages to disaccharidescontaining 4-deoxy-beta-D-gluc-4-enuronosyl groups

name: heparin lyase
definition: Eliminative cleavage of polysaccharides containing (1->4)-linkedD-glucuronate or L-iduronate residues and (1->4)-alpha-linked2-sulfoamino-2-deoxy-6-sulfo-D-glucose residues to give oligosaccharideswith terminal 4-deoxy-alpha-D-gluc-4-enuronosyl groups at their non-reducing ends

name: heparin-sulfate lyase

name: pectate disaccharide-lyase

name: peptidoglycan lytic endotransglycosylase

name: beta-geranylfarnesene synthase

name: vetispiradiene synthase

name: germacrene-A synthase

name: D-serine ammonia-lyase

name: threonine ammonia-lyase

definition: a (3R)-3-[(carboxymethyl)amino]fatty acid + holo-[ACP] + H(+) = a (2E)-enoyl-[ACP] + glycine + H2O

name: gamma-glutamylcyclotransferase

definition: aldehydo-D-ribose 5-phosphate + D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate +L-glutamine = pyridoxal 5'-phosphate + L-glutamate + phosphate + 3 H2O +H(+)

name: selenocysteine lyase
definition: L-selenocysteine + AH2 = hydrogenselenide + L-alanine + A + H(+)

name: holocytochrome-c synthase

name: homocysteine desulfhydrase

name: L-cysteine desulfidase

definition: (1) phycocyanobilin-L-cysteinyl(84)-[C-phycocyanin beta-subunit] = apo-L-cysteinyl(84)-[C-phycocyanin beta-subunit] + (2R,3E)-phycocyanobilin(2) phycocyanobilin-L-cysteinyl(84)-[phycoerythrocyanin beta-subunit] =apo-L-cysteinyl(84)-[phycoerythrocyanin beta-subunit] + (2R,3E)-phycocyanobilin(3) phycocyanobilin-L-cysteinyl(84)-[allophycocyanin alpha-subunit] =apo-L-cysteinyl(84)-[allophycocyanin alpha-subunit] + (2R,3E)-phycocyanobilin(4) phycocyanobilin-L-cysteinyl(84)-[allophycocyanin beta-subunit] = apo-L-cysteinyl(84)-[allophycocyanin beta-subunit] + (2R,3E)-phycocyanobilin(5) phycoerythrobilin-L-cysteinyl(84)-[C-phycoerythrin alpha-subunit] =apo-L-cysteinyl(84)-[C-phycoerythrin alpha-subunit] + (2R,3E)-phycoerythrobilin(6) phycoerythrobilin-L-cysteinyl(84)-[C-phycoerythrin beta-subunit] =apo-L-cysteinyl(84)-[C-phycoerythrin beta-subunit] + (2R,3E)-phycoerythrobilin

name: hercynylcysteine S-oxide lyase

synonyms: L-cysteine sulfoxide lyase|alliinase|cysteine sulfoxide lyase|cysteine sulphoxide lyase

name: glycosylphosphatidylinositol diacylglycerol-lyase

name: ribonuclease U2

name: ribotoxin

name: bacteriophage T4 restriction endoribonuclease RegB

name: protoporphyrin ferrochelatase

name: magnesium dechelatase
